project_description: SRA009008 experiment by Marine Biological Laboratory   PCR amplification of the SSU rRNA gene V6 region using primers targeting a diverse set of bacteria

biome.definition: The environmental biome represents the major classes of ecologically similar communities of plants, animals, and other organisms. Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO terms listed under environmental biome can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00000428

material.definition: The environmental material level refers to the matter that was displaced by the sample, prior to the sampling event. Environmental matter terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO terms listed under environmental matter can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00010483

elevation.definition: The elevation of the sampling site in meters as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

temperature.definition: Temperature of the sample in celsius at time of sampling

collection_timezone.definition: The timezone of sampling.  Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. UTC-7

collection_date.definition: The date of sampling. Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. 2008-01-23

country.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1397)

altitude.definition: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance in meters between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

env_package.definition: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. Use one of: air, host-associated, human-associated, human-skin, human-oral, human-gut, human-vaginal, microbial mat|biofilm, miscellaneous, plant-associated, sediment, soil, wastewater|sludge, water

feature.definition: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO terms listed under environmental feature can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00002297

longitude.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The value should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

depth.definition: Depth is defined as the vertical distance in meters below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectivly.

location.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific local region name

sample_name.definition: Unique name or id of the sample

latitude.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The value should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

continent.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by continent.  Use one of: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America, South America

collection_time.definition: The local time of sampling.  Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. 19:23:10

metagenome_name.definition: Unique name for the sequences from this library
metagenome_name.value: Sewage Influent Bacterial SSU rRNA V6 tag sequencing, Jones Island 8/21/07

investigation_type.definition: Library construction type. This field is either metagenome for whole genome shotgun sequencing or mimarks-survey for amplicon/16S rRNA sequencing

forward_barcodes.definition: List of barcodes attached to forward primers
forward_barcodes.value: A cocktail of five fused primers at the 5%u2019 end of the V6 region (E. coli positions 967- 985) and four primers at the 3%u2019 end (E. coli positions 1046-1028) captured the full diversity of rRNA sequences represented in molecular databases (Sogin et al., 2006; Huber et al., 2007). The 5%u2019 fused primer includes a 5 nt %u201Ckey%u201D inserted between the Life Sciences primer A and the 967F rRNA primer.  We prepared amplicon libraries from at least three independent PCR cocktails for each sample to minimize the impact of potential early-round PCR errors, and sequenced using standard Roche protocols on a GS-FLX.

seq_meth.definition: Sequencing method used. Use one of: Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid, 454, Illumina, assembeled, other

sample_name.definition: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

biome.definition: The environmental biome represents the major classes of ecologically similar communities of plants, animals, and other organisms. Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO terms listed under environmental biome can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00000428

feature.definition: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO terms listed under environmental feature can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00002297

longitude.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The value should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

depth.definition: Depth is defined as the vertical distance in meters below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectivly.

location.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific local region name

sample_name.definition: Unique name or id of the sample

latitude.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The value should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

continent.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by continent.  Use one of: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America, South America

collection_time.definition: The local time of sampling.  Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. 19:23:10

metagenome_name.definition: Unique name for the sequences from this library
metagenome_name.value: Sewage Influent Bacterial SSU rRNA V6 tag sequencing, South Shore 4/20/05

investigation_type.definition: Library construction type. This field is either metagenome for whole genome shotgun sequencing or mimarks-survey for amplicon/16S rRNA sequencing

forward_barcodes.definition: List of barcodes attached to forward primers
forward_barcodes.value: A cocktail of five fused primers at the 5%u2019 end of the V6 region (E. coli positions 967- 985) and four primers at the 3%u2019 end (E. coli positions 1046-1028) captured the full diversity of rRNA sequences represented in molecular databases (Sogin et al., 2006; Huber et al., 2007). The 5%u2019 fused primer includes a 5 nt %u201Ckey%u201D inserted between the Life Sciences primer A and the 967F rRNA primer.  We prepared amplicon libraries from at least three independent PCR cocktails for each sample to minimize the impact of potential early-round PCR errors, and sequenced using standard Roche protocols on a GS-FLX.

seq_meth.definition: Sequencing method used. Use one of: Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid, 454, Illumina, assembeled, other

sample_name.definition: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

biome.definition: The environmental biome represents the major classes of ecologically similar communities of plants, animals, and other organisms. Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO terms listed under environmental biome can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00000428

material.definition: The environmental material level refers to the matter that was displaced by the sample, prior to the sampling event. Environmental matter terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO terms listed under environmental matter can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00010483

elevation.definition: The elevation of the sampling site in meters as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

temperature.definition: Temperature of the sample in celsius at time of sampling

collection_timezone.definition: The timezone of sampling.  Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. UTC-7

collection_date.definition: The date of sampling. Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. 2008-01-23

country.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1397)

altitude.definition: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance in meters between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

env_package.definition: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. Use one of: air, host-associated, human-associated, human-skin, human-oral, human-gut, human-vaginal, microbial mat|biofilm, miscellaneous, plant-associated, sediment, soil, wastewater|sludge, water
